description: BigLakeTable is the Schema for the BigLakeTable API

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: BigLakeTableSpec defines the desired state of BigLakeTable

parameters.description: Stores user supplied Hive table parameters.

storageDescriptor.description: Stores physical storage information of the data.

inputFormat.description: The fully qualified Java class name of the input format.

locationURI.description: Cloud Storage folder URI where the table data is stored, starting with "gs://".

outputFormat.description: The fully qualified Java class name of the output format.

serializationLib.description: The fully qualified Java class name of the serialization library.

tableType.description: Hive table type. For example, MANAGED_TABLE, EXTERNAL_TABLE.

parentDatabaseRef.description: Required. The parent resource where this table will be created. Format: projects/{project_id_or_number}/locations/{location_id}/catalogs/{catalog_id}/databases/{database_id}

external.description: A reference to an externally managed BigQueryBigLakeDatabase resource. Should be in the format "projects/{{projectID}}/locations/{{location}}/catalogs/{{catalogID}}/databases/{{databaseID}}".

name.description: The name of a BigQueryBigLakeDatabase resource.

namespace.description: The namespace of a BigQueryBigLakeDatabase resource.

resourceID.description: The BigLake Table ID. If not given, the metadata.name will be used.

status.description: BigLakeTableStatus defines the config connector machine state of BigLakeTable

conditions.description: Conditions represent the latest available observations of the object's current state.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: Human-readable message indicating details about last transition.

reason.description: Unique, one-word, CamelCase reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status is the status of the condition. Can be True, False, Unknown.

type.description: Type is the type of the condition.

externalRef.description: A unique specifier for the BigLakeTable resource in GCP.

observedGeneration.description: ObservedGeneration is the generation of the resource that was most recently observed by the Config Connector controller. If this is equal to metadata.generation, then that means that the current reported status reflects the most recent desired state of the resource.

observedState.description: ObservedState is the state of the resource as most recently observed in GCP.

createTime.description: Output only. The creation time of the table.

deleteTime.description: Output only. The deletion time of the table. Only set after the table is deleted.

expireTime.description: Output only. The time when this table is considered expired. Only set after the table is deleted.

updateTime.description: Output only. The last modification time of the table.
